school_story_8_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE With currency it works the same way really.

school_story_8_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If one currency is worth more than the other, you give more of it than you get back in the exchange.

school_story_9_screen_1_title:
PLZ_TRANSLATE Ready to dive a little deeper into currency and specifically crypto currency?
Crypto currencies haven't existed very long.
school_story_9_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE About 20 years ago the first ever crypto currency came; BitCoin.
school_story_9_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now there are more of them, like Litecoin or Ethereum. Crypto currencies only exist online on screen, in a digital form.
school_story_9_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But there are also other important differences between these and regular ones.
school_story_9_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The most important difference, is that they are decentralized.
school_story_9_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's do a recap of what we know about the regular or classical currencies.
school_story_9_screen_3_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Please do, I don't remember
school_story_9_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, remember I told you about how the governments took control over the money?
school_story_9_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It didn't happen everywhere at the same time, but all regular currencies became centralized. Usually by the state.
school_story_9_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Every centralized currency has a central bank controlling it. For example the american dollar in USA has the Federal Reserve.
school_story_9_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The first central bank in the world was and still is in Sweden. It's called Riksbanken and was founded in 1668.
school_story_9_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE When they took control over it, deciding the value of the money, they centralized the currency.
school_story_9_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Meaning that the state now was responsible for the value, but also to print the money and decide how much to make.
school_story_9_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hey, why don't they just make a lot?
school_story_9_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Unfortunately its not that easy. Supply and demand also applies here actually.
school_story_9_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If a country just starts to print a lot of money, that will start a process where it will lose it's value.
school_story_9_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know, economical systems are quite complicated, but it's good if we understand the basics. Let's do a simple example.
school_story_9_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Remember the example of supply and demand and the price of apples?
school_story_9_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, but remind me of the details
school_story_9_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Right, so we were talking about supply, and I told you that when it is apple season, stores can't have high prices on apples
school_story_9_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because it is so easy for the buyer to get them everywhere, apples loose value.
school_story_9_screen_11_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now you have part of the picture, and we'll add demand. Remember? Demand is how many that want a product.
school_story_9_screen_11_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And when demand is high price goes up. Now imagine you have a store selling shoes.
school_story_9_screen_11_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will sell blue shoes
school_story_9_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE One day you realize that more and more people have bought shoes lately.
school_story_9_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Also, they buy three pairs at a time! Wouldn't you increase the prices?
school_story_9_screen_12_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Absolutely! I would make more money!
school_story_9_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, any good buissness man or woman would!
school_story_9_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's put the pieces together now to understand why it's not good to flood the country with money.
school_story_9_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So, the state prints a lot of extra money, it is more available and people have more. They start buying more and spending more.
school_story_9_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Like you in your shoe shop, all vendors and stores raise their prices. Everything gets more expensive. And the money loses value.
school_story_9_screen_14_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, that doesn't sound good
school_story_9_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, its not. And it becomes a bad cycle that the whole country suffers from and it is not an easy situation to fix.
school_story_9_screen_15_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have heard that before
school_story_9_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now that you know more about centralized currency and what that means, we can go back to the other type of currency: crypto currency.
school_story_9_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Crypto currency is <bold>not</bold> centralized. No state or central bank controls it. And as it only exists digitally no one prints it.
school_story_9_screen_16_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE How does it work then?
school_story_9_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Good question! Actually, it is more alike the barter system, because it is not backed up with the assurance of value by a central bank.
school_story_9_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE No one guarantees the value of the BitCoin for example, it is completely based on trust between users.
school_story_9_screen_17_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Any money is fine for me!
school_story_9_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The last big difference is that the money transfers go directly between users.
school_story_9_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So it is a so called peer-to-peer system, with no bank or others being involved.
school_story_9_screen_19_title:
PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's sum it up.
There are three major differences between crypto currency and regular currency:
school_story_9_screen_19_subtitle:
PLZ_TRANSLATE 1.Crypto currency only exists digitally.
2.Regular currency is centralized, crypto currency is not.
3.Crypto currency peer to peer and based on trust.

school_story_12_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But be careful, some sites want you to pay to sell your things! There are also selling apps you could use. But make sure you read all the information and if it costs anything.
school_story_12_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE When using the internet to sell things it's also important to think about how the person will get the item you sell.
school_story_12_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Will they pick it up? Or will you send it? You have to have a plan for it before you start.

school_story_12_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't want to nag, but when selling things (or earning, spending or saving) It's important to check with your parents.

school_story_12_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE you can start comparing prices in different stores. When you know what pair of headphones you want, you can check what store that has the best price.
school_story_12_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is very smart, sometimes that could save you a couple of hundreds! And if you are patient and extra nifty, you will plan for a sale...

school_story_13_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Congratulations on reaching this planet... Because this is a very important planet! Remember, the three staples of private finances are:
school_story_13_screen_1_subtitle:
PLZ_TRANSLATE  Earning, saving and spending.
You already learned a bit about earning on planet 4, here we will talk about saving.
school_story_13_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Before we go on about saving, I wanted to explain another word to you! You know what a product is, it's a thing you can buy. But what about something you buy that is not a thing?
school_story_13_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE That is called a service. Like Netflix, which is a streaming service. Or if you go to a store and pay them to fix your broken screen on the phone, then you buy a service. So you can buy a product, or a service!
school_story_13_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You probably already know what saving means, but I thought I would explain it a bit deeper.
school_story_13_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Do you save any money?
school_story_13_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you do it's great. If you don't, you should really start doing that! Saving is in it's most basic form very simple. It just means that you keep more than you spend.
school_story_13_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Remember in the beginning, when people used coins? The people that had trouble carrying all their coins, they had so much because they had earned and saved a lot.
school_story_13_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can see it clearly when you save coins and bills in a piggy bank in your house, but also if you save in the piggy bank in the Gimi app. The stash grows everytime you save instead of spending!
school_story_13_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is very simple math, that you probably already did in the first grades in school. Simple addition and subtraction.
school_story_13_screen_5_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, I learned that already!
school_story_13_screen_5_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, haven't been to school yet
school_story_13_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So you probably know also, that everything can be added and subtracted in the same way. Doesn't matter if it is apples, Robux or money.
school_story_13_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's see if you remember what the words I'm using mean... What is addition?
school_story_13_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you add things
school_story_13_screen_6_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you take away things
school_story_13_screen_6_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you eat the apples
school_story_13_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you add things! If you have 5 apples, you add 2 and get 7, that's called addition in math.
school_story_13_screen_7_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you add things
school_story_13_screen_7_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you take away things
school_story_13_screen_7_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you eat the apples
school_story_13_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you take away, or subtract things! If you have 5 apples and take away 2 and have 3 left, that's called subtraction in math.
school_story_13_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, yes. I know all this!
school_story_13_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know that this might be very simple for you but I wanted to explain this, just in case.
school_story_13_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Also to make you understand that when dealing with money and finances you use math to count everything, and to understand how things are connected. Often very simple math.
school_story_13_screen_9_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You said saving is important?
school_story_13_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, let's go back to that. I explained the math words, because you can explain it well with math.
school_story_13_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You should never spend more than you have, right?
school_story_13_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Answering why you should not spend more than you have is where addition and subtraction comes in.
school_story_13_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you have those 5 apples, you only have 5 apples. You can't eat more than 5 apples because you don't have anymore.
school_story_13_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But if you deal with money, in bank accounts you can sometimes spend more than you have, and get a negative balance in your account.
school_story_13_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is bad because when you spend more than you have you actually loan money from the bank. Or somebody else. And loans cost money, like you would buy a product or service.
school_story_13_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Also, that means you would have less than you started out with, and would have to pay that back, and also earn more to have some money again.
school_story_13_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay! So, you have 5pb. If you spend 7pb on candy bar, that means you had to borrow or lend 2 pb from the bank.
school_story_13_screen_15_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE This is such easy math!
school_story_13_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Next week maybe you want to buy something else for 3pb. But you don't have any money, and you owe the bank 2pb. Also, if you borrowed from the bank, that loan costs money also.
school_story_13_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Loans from banks and other providers are also a service you have to pay for. So now you owe the bank the 2pb you borrowed, AND the cost of the loan, 0,5pb. If you keep subtracting money and spend, then you will eventually be in debt.
school_story_13_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is bad. I will explain when you get to another planet, about what happens when you overspend, and end up in debt as it is called. You need to know!
school_story_13_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But by saving, you can make sure you have money when you want to spend it, and make sure that you are never have a negative balance!
school_story_13_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because by saving, you add instead of subtracting.
school_story_13_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Of course spending is necessary, and something you should do sometimes. But you should spend in a smart way. And one way of doing that is to save up for things beforehand.
school_story_13_screen_18_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want to know more!
school_story_13_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let me show you with math again. Let's say you have the same 5pb. You save 3pb every week for three weeks.
school_story_13_screen_20_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now you have 14pb. If you want to buy that candy bar for 7pb, you have 7pb left after the purchase.
school_story_13_screen_20_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You still have money left and don't have to borrow or pay any fees for loans!
school_story_13_screen_20_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But I don't like saving
school_story_13_screen_21_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE That is why saving is important. Spending more than you have is more expensive, and can cause a lot of trouble.
school_story_13_screen_21_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Always making sure to have some money saved up and to have a buffer is very smart money practice and a real financial superskill!
school_story_13_screen_22_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yup, so to summarize this destination's take-away message:
school_story_13_screen_22_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Basic, simple saving is putting away money, letting the sum you have grow over time and earning more than you spend.

school_story_14_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I did explain previously that saving is very important so that you don't over-spend.
school_story_14_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because that makes the things you buy more expensive, and it is very hard to catch up once you go that way.
school_story_14_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, because loaning costs money
school_story_14_screen_6_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I remember, I will save instead
school_story_14_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE That is really the most important thing about saving. But it is also true that saving is good because you can get more money by saving!
school_story_14_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, when you save your money in a bank, in what is called a savings account, you earn interest.
school_story_14_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Interest is a percentage of money the bank gives you for keeping your money there.
school_story_14_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Wait, the bank gives me money?
school_story_14_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can say that. What happens is that by keeping your money in the bank, you actually loan your money to them.
school_story_14_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And the bank pays you for that loan with an interest on your money. So the longer you keep them there and the more you save, the more you earn!
school_story_14_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The banks guarantee that you will get your money back in the regular saving accounts. But you usually lock them for a time, but after you get them all back, + interest!
school_story_14_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are other ways to save where there also is a risk of loosing some, but that give even more interest.
school_story_14_screen_10_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want to earn more, tell me how!
school_story_14_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's wait a bit with those, because it's a bit more you need to know before.
school_story_14_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are many different ways to save, but generally they can be divided into long term saving and short term saving.
school_story_14_screen_12_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, long term and short term
school_story_14_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's start with short term saving.
school_story_14_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The simplest way of short term saving is to put away your money, and try not to spend them.
school_story_14_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It can be pretty hard! But in that way you make sure that you have money for the things you really need or want.
school_story_14_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The money disappears quickly when you buy a soda here and an ice cream there...
school_story_14_screen_14_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know, that's why I save!
school_story_14_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Another way of short term saving, is when you save up for something that may not be that expensive.
school_story_14_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So you save your money, but maybe not in a savings account, because you don't want to lock them.
school_story_14_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Long term saving as you might suspect, is when you save for a long time.
school_story_14_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Long term savings can also be for different lengths of time. For example saving for something very expensive like a new smartphone.
school_story_14_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE That would take some time to save up to, maybe even a couple of years if you don't earn extra money. But there are long term savings that last almost your entire life!
school_story_14_screen_17_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have saved for years already!
school_story_14_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes saving really shouldn't end. The best way is to have a balance between long term and short term savings.
school_story_14_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And you don't have to think about the really long term savings yet, but when you become an adult you should start as soon as possible.
school_story_14_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I decided. I will divide the money I earned into both long term and short term saving!

school_story_15_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay. Nevermind. Savings buffer is the topic. A buffer is store of something. In finance, it means that you save up a store, or buffer, of money.
school_story_15_screen_3_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Is my piggybank a buffer?
school_story_15_screen_3_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hmm... I need to know more
school_story_15_screen_3_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I think I have a savings account
school_story_15_screen_3_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Don't have one I spent it
school_story_15_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Your piggybank could be a savings buffer. It depends on if you have some money saved up. More than you spend.
school_story_15_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE A savings buffer is often what the short time saving that you learned about in the previous story is called.
school_story_15_screen_4_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But what is it for again?
school_story_15_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, like I said it is when you save more than you spend, but you save it ‚Äòfor a rainy day‚Äô
school_story_15_screen_5_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE What's the difference from short term saving?
school_story_15_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The difference is, that you are not saving up for something special, you are just saving in case something comes up.
school_story_15_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's very important as an adult, as things that are important and expensive can break. Like the car or the heat if you live in a house.
school_story_15_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If the car breaks and it is an expensive repair, maybe you can't afford it after you have payed your bills.
school_story_15_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But you have to repair it, because you might not get to work otherwise! If you have a savings buffer you have the extra money to pay, without ruining your budget.
school_story_15_screen_7_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But I am not an adult...
school_story_15_screen_7_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't think I need a buffer?
school_story_15_screen_7_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will start when I grow up
school_story_15_screen_7_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So I can spend now?
school_story_15_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But it is important for everyone! Even children.. also cool kids like you. Firstly, like with all finance and money matters it's very important to practice early.
school_story_15_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE These money matters are hard for adults too, and the earlier you start the good habits and practice, the better you will get! That goes for all financial superskills!
school_story_15_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I get it, and more?
school_story_15_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE And second, you also can have things happening that you have to pay for, that you didn't expect. Let's say you just got a new smartphone.
school_story_15_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You drop it, and the screen breaks. Your parents tell you that you should have taken care of it better, and that you have to pay for it yourself.
school_story_15_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you Don't have a savings buffer, you would have to save for a long time to get the screen fixed. It's quite expensive!

school_story_15_screen_10_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I would have to save for months!

school_story_15_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let me tell you about some smart ways and hacks that can help you save more!
school_story_15_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE My first tip is about bonus! As a kid it might be hard to get accounts and interest from banks. But in the Gimi app you can get bonus!
school_story_15_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Bonus works like interest. But your parents pay it for the money you save in your Gimi piggybank!
school_story_15_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can agree and discuss with your parents what the rate should be, and then when you have payday you will get extra money!
school_story_15_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Interest rate if you remember, is a percentage from the banks in savings accounts, and bonus works the same way. Let's say you have 100pb in your piggybank.
school_story_15_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you have a bonus rate of 0,05%, after payday you will have 5pb extra, just from bonus!
school_story_15_screen_15_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Saving money really pays off!
school_story_15_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yup! My second tip is something called ‚Äòmatched saving‚Äô. It's really simple, it's saving some yourself and getting the same amount for it.
school_story_15_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you ask your parents, or another family member and see if they would like to negotiate a deal to encourage you and help you to save. Maybe if you save up 100, they will give you 100?
school_story_15_screen_16_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Nah, seems like a lot of work
school_story_15_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't know, it depends on your family, remember to ask and negotiate in a nice professional manner, don't demand! They don't owe you or have to agree.
school_story_15_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, so another hack is to set saving goals. Actually, I have seen that kids that use the goal map in the app and set savings goals are generally better at saving!
school_story_15_screen_17_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I use it, am I better at saving?
school_story_15_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is true! So the researchers can't say for sure why, but they can make educated guesses and they think, it's because it is motivating to see your progress!
school_story_15_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So if you're not using it and want to get better at saving, use the goal map! Or make your own! The important part is to set a savings goal and check out how it's going along the way.
school_story_15_screen_18_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, cool. Anymore tips or hacks?
school_story_15_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yup, I have one last one, and this one you can do all by yourself! It's called the ‚Äòthe round-up method.‚Äô
school_story_15_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's a hack, where you always put away or save some money when you buy things.
school_story_15_screen_20_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's also simple, and a way to trick yourself to save often but just a little. But you know what they say: ‚Äòfrom acorns grow oak trees,‚Äô every little helps!
school_story_15_screen_20_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So every time you buy something, you round up to the closest 10, or whatever you decide, and you put away the difference in savings.
school_story_15_screen_20_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Can you please give an example?
school_story_15_screen_21_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, an example is that you buy a pizza. The pizza costs 85pb. If you round up to the nearest 10, that is 90pb. The difference between 85 and 90 is 5. You then take 5pb and put in savings.
school_story_15_screen_21_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Or you buy a hat, you pay 349pb, you round up to 350, the difference is 1pb, so you put that in savings.
school_story_15_screen_21_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Sounds like I would save very little?
school_story_15_screen_22_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes it's a little every time, but that makes it easy and you don't notice it much. And you do it many times! So it collects! It becomes a way to trick yourself to save! And everything you save is great!
school_story_15_screen_22_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I think you are ready for the challenge! And try one of the tips!

school_story_22_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Welcome back to Fido and me on the planet where you will learn more about saving.
school_story_22_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE We will build on what you have learned, and talk a bit about investments too!
school_story_22_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE On Planet 5, I went through the basics of saving and why it is important.
school_story_22_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And as you know, there are many ways to save!
school_story_22_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE We are going to talk more about saving money at the bank.
school_story_22_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are many different options to choose from, and that is why it is good to know about them so you can choose how you want to save.
school_story_22_screen_3_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I'm saving at the bank!
school_story_22_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you save at the bank, the account you have is called a savings account. This is where you place your money.
school_story_22_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Banks want you to save money through them, do you know why?
school_story_22_screen_4_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because they can use the money!
school_story_22_screen_4_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Do they want to swim in them like Scrooge McDuck?
school_story_22_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you remember from the previous planet about saving, they are borrowing your money!
school_story_22_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE They can use your money, and in return you get paid. Do you remember what it's called?
school_story_22_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, it‚Äôs interest I'm talking about. Sometimes it's specifically called YYsavings rate.YY(vet inte om denna √∂vers√§ttning √§r helt 100) The interest is paid out once a year.
school_story_22_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The savings rate is generally quite low, often between 0 and 0.5%.
school_story_22_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It can be difficult to understand in percent only, so I have an example.
school_story_22_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you have saved 1000 SEK at the bank for a year and the saving rate is 0.5%, then you get 5 SEK in interest.
school_story_22_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You may not think that 5 SEK is that much money.
school_story_22_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then it could be good to know that there are ways to get higher interest rates!
school_story_22_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you can promise the bank that they can borrow your money over a longer period of time, they will give you more interest.
school_story_22_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE I also mentioned this on planet 5, but if you don't remember, you can lock your money, so you promise the bank they can keep them longer before you want to be able to use them again.
school_story_22_screen_9_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now that you mention it‚Ä¶
school_story_22_screen_11_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So if you lock your money for 3 years, for example, you can get up to 1% interest!
school_story_22_screen_11_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you save 1000 SEK and lock them for 3 years for 1% interest, you will receive 10 SEK in interest every year instead.
school_story_22_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes it doesn‚Äôt sound like much, but the more you save and the longer you save the more you get paid out of the interest!
school_story_22_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE On this planet I'll tell you more about how to earn even more from saving, but first I want tell you something else.
school_story_22_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Believe it or not, but it has actually happened that a bank runs out of money!
school_story_22_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then they have borrowed more than they can pay. Banks actually also borrow money from each other. So it is not just us ordinary people who can end up in debt!
school_story_22_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE ‚ÄôBut what happens then?‚Äô You are probably thinking? What happens to all the money you have struggled to save?
school_story_22_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE To protect your money, there is something called a deposit protection.
school_story_22_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Deposit protection. That‚Äôs a long word!
school_story_22_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Think of a deposit, that is, money that you put into the account, and protection. Protection means they are kept safe. So it is a promise that you will get back the money you deposited into the account.
school_story_22_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is the Swedish state that promises to give you the money back.
school_story_22_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But there is a limit to how much money you can be sure of getting back from the bank. Do you know how much it is?
school_story_22_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The correct answer is 1 million!!!
school_story_22_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE That means you can save risk-free up to at least 1 million without losing them, so just start saving!
school_story_22_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE I used the word risk-free, do you know what risk is?
school_story_22_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, risk is actually a pretty advanced concept that you have to understand if you want to save and invest in ways where you can earn more.
school_story_22_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So we‚Äôll take that on a destination of it‚Äôs own!
school_story_22_screen_19_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Want to make more money!
school_story_23_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I promised I would teach you more about investing, it's a way to use your money. It's often called a kind of saving
school_story_23_screen_1_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Wait, both saving and using at the same time?
school_story_23_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes it is actually both. Have you ever heard someone talk about ‚Äôsaving in shares‚Äô?
school_story_23_screen_2_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes I think I have
school_story_23_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You use both the words save and invest, because you take your money and put it away in shares. But you also use it because you buy shares for them with the hope that the money will grow.
school_story_23_screen_3_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But what does investing mean?
school_story_23_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Invest is a word that means putting money into something with the hope that it will yield a profit, or return as it is called.
school_story_23_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There is a risk, and the more you can win, the greater the risk. But we‚Äôll take that on the last destination.
school_story_23_screen_4_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Tell me more about investing now!
school_story_23_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, let‚Äôs do it! Have you thought about what a company is?
school_story_23_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE A company is a business that provides products or services for sale.
school_story_23_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You've probably heard of Disney, IKEA, Coca Cola or Spotify? All of them are companies.
school_story_23_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE And you already know what products and services are.
school_story_23_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are a lot of companies in Sweden, about 300.000!
school_story_23_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can think of companies as fruit trees in a garden. And there are different kinds of fruit trees, and there are lots of different kinds of companies as well.
school_story_23_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE A start-up companyYY(vet inte om vi vill kalla det start-up eller bara kalla det newly started) is like a newly planted tree. And a newly planted tree is more sensitive than a full-grown tree. It needs a lot of water and nutrition.
school_story_23_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The same is true of start-ups, they need nutrition and water in the form of money and dedicated and skilled employees to survive.
school_story_23_screen_10_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Where are you going with this Piggy?
school_story_23_screen_11_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You will see how it is all connected!
school_story_23_screen_11_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If a company gets its nutrition and water steady and does not experience a storm, it will grow and become more stable. Once a company has grown large enough, they can start selling parts of itself to you.
school_story_23_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then you can buy shares! Shares are a small part of the company that you buy. And if it goes well for the company and it grows, so does the value of the shares.
school_story_23_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's why it's an investment, you buy shares in a company for a price, and hope it grows so you can sell them later for a higher price!
school_story_23_screen_12_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want to try it
school_story_23_screen_12_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want to learn about risk first!
school_story_23_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE When you own these shares, that is part of the company, you also have the right to receive a part of what the company has earned during the year, it is called a dividend.
school_story_23_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You have to keep in mind that if things go badly for the company instead, then the shares will decrease in value and you will lose money when you sell your shares.
school_story_23_screen_13_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE No! I want a dividend!
school_story_23_screen_13_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Sounds no good at all.
school_story_23_screen_13_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You have to water more!
school_story_23_screen_13_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You have to keep your fingers crossed
school_story_23_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let‚Äôs go back to our example of trees. If you buy a tree when it's just a newly planted twig, but sell it when it's grown into a big apple tree, you get more money when you sell it.
school_story_23_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And the dividend I talked about is like the fruit on the tree! You can get more or less fruit in a year depending on the weather.
school_story_23_screen_14_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I still can‚Äôt see how it's connected
school_story_23_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you want to buy shares, it's good to know a lot about the company.
school_story_23_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because you do not know how it‚Äôs gonna go for neither companies nor trees in the future, you guess and take a risk.
school_story_23_screen_15_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Knowing a lot is good
school_story_23_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Investing in a company is like buying a newly planted tree for a small price. Then hopefully it grows bigger and starts to bear fruit. And then you can sell when it's a big tree!
school_story_23_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You get money from the fruit every year, depending on the weather, and make money selling it more expensive! But there is a risk that it will wither or die and then you will lose the money.
school_story_23_screen_16_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I like fruit. And money!
school_story_23_screen_16_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can buy the right tree!
school_story_23_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I think that is enough new knowledge for the moment. See you soon!
school_story_23_screen_17_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I‚Äôll just eat some fruit first
school_story_24_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well then let‚Äôs go, so what is risk?
school_story_24_screen_1_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Falling down from a tree
school_story_24_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE All those options are about risky stuff. But what about just risk? It's actually a word that even adults can have a hard time defining.
school_story_24_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But I think the best description is that it is the probability, or the chance, that something undesirable or negative will happen.
school_story_24_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Often the words risk and chance are seen as opposites, so chance is when you talk about positive things and risk is when you talk about negative things.
school_story_24_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Imagine you are lending money to someone. Have you ever lent money?
school_story_24_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you have done so, you will of course expect to get your money back in a week or two.
school_story_24_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But there is a risk that you will not get your money back. How big that risk is depends on who you lend to.
school_story_24_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The more you know about the person, the easier it is to decide if you want to lend money or not.
school_story_24_screen_6_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I didn‚Äôt get mine back!
school_story_24_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If there is someone you trust and who has money, the risk is low. Then it feels OK to lend money.
school_story_24_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If there is someone you do not know and who has no money, the risk is high that you will not get your money back.
school_story_24_screen_7_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Can you take another example?
school_story_24_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, guess if the risk is high or low that you will get your money back if you lend it to:
school_story_24_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Alien, you know it has money at home. And when you last lent money to Alien, you got it back the next day.
school_story_24_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The correct answer was: Low! Guess if the risk is high or low that you will get your money back if you lend it to:
school_story_24_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Toasty, who just bought something expensive for all his money. And Toasty has not returned the money it borrowed from two of your friends last month.
school_story_24_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The correct answer was: High!
school_story_24_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE When it comes to saving and investing, risk is important to keep in mind. As in a savings account with that deposit protection, there is very low risk ...
school_story_24_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE ...but it also has low growth. You make very little money from the interest rate as you remember.
school_story_24_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Risk is what allows you to grow your money more. But it is also the risk that makes you lose your money.
school_story_24_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE We're going back to our garden of fruit trees again.
school_story_24_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE We say you want to grow bananas in Sweden. If you can do it, you will be richly rewarded because no one else has succeeded in doing so. Now it is popular to buy food grown locally, then you get a huge return!
school_story_24_screen_13_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I do not like bananas
school_story_24_screen_13_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Can you grow money trees?
school_story_24_screen_13_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don‚Äôt have green fingers
school_story_24_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE At the same time it is almost impossible because we do not have the right climate. There is a high risk that things will go badly and you will lose the money you spent on the plants.
school_story_24_screen_14_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Shoot, I just started looking for banana seeds
school_story_24_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE There is also a risk that something unpredictable will happen. If there is a storm, all your fruit trees may die.
school_story_24_screen_15_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Whatever, it‚Äôs tiresome to water them anyways
school_story_24_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE And both in investments in companies, and if you are going to grow fruit trees, you can protect yourself by spreading the risk.
school_story_24_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It means you buy smaller amounts, but of many different varieties. So instead of betting everything on one horse, you spread the risk.
school_story_24_screen_16_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Ah, like a bag of mixed candy!
school_story_24_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let‚Äôs say you only have apple trees in your garden. One year there will be a disease, apple plague. Then all your trees will die and you will have lost all the money you put in.
school_story_24_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But if you have both banana trees, plum trees and apple trees instead, then you have all the banana trees and plum trees left after the apple plague.
school_story_24_screen_17_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Noted. Spreading the risk is smart
school_story_24_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE When it comes to trading shares, there is an easy way to buy shares in many different companies, and that is to buy mutual funds.
school_story_24_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You then buy shares in an entire fund. They often contain between 20 and 100 different companies!
